intro: Galium timeroyi subsp. fleurotii, commonly known as the fleurot's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
